word_mean: 护理：提供各种水平的必需或有帮助的服务，以增进、保持和恢复健康，或者为预防疾病，如对婴儿、体弱或受伤者或因各种原因而不能自我服务的人提供必需的和有益的服务。有时根据病人的年龄来给护理定名(如儿童或老人护理)，或者根据他们特殊的健康问题定名(如妇科、内科、产科、骨科、精神病科、外科、泌尿科护理等)，或者以提供服务的场所定名(如办公室、学校或职业性保健护理)

sentence.Network_en: He died in a nursing home at the age of 87.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在一家养老院去世，享年87岁。

sentence.Network_en: Nursing auxiliaries provide basic care, but are not qualified nurses.
sentence.Network_cn: 助理护士只提供基本护理，不具备护士资格。

sentence.Network_en: She resolved to report the matter to the hospital's nursing manager.
sentence.Network_cn: 她决定把这件事汇报给医院的护士长。

entry.def: Nursing is the profession of looking after people who are ill.

Sentence.sentence: But as the nursing shortage worsens, a growing number of schools and hospitals are establishing "fast-track programs" that enable college graduates with no nursing experience to become registered nurses with only a year or so of specialized training.

But as the nursing shortage worsens, a growing number of schools and hospitals are establishing "fast-track programs" that enable college graduates with no nursing experience to become registered nurses with only a year or so of specialized training.
Students earn their bachelor of science in nursing in a year.
